member.name: M:Crystal.Shared.DatatableDecorator._GetPropertyInfo(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Get properties from the Entity including nested properties

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableRequest`1.Start
member.summary: Paging first record indicator. This is the start point in the current data set (0 index based - i.e. 0 is the first record)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableRequest`1.Length
member.summary: Number of records that the table can display in the current draw. It is expected that the number of records returned will be equal to this number, unless the server has fewer records to return. Note that this can be -1 to indicate that all records should be returned (although that negates any benefits of server-side processing!)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableRequest`1.Search
member.summary: Global Search for the table

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableRequest`1.Order
member.summary: Collection of all column indexes and their sort directions

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableRequest`1.Columns
member.summary: Collection of all columns in the table

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Column.Data
member.summary: Column's data source

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Column.Name
member.summary: Column's name

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Column.Searchable
member.summary: Flag to indicate if this column is searchable (true) or not (false)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Column.Orderable
member.summary: Flag to indicate if this column is orderable (true) or not (false)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Column.Search
member.summary: Search to apply to this specific column.

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Search.Value
member.summary: Global search value. To be applied to all columns which have searchable as true

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Search.Regex
member.summary: true if the global filter should be treated as a regular expression for advanced searching, false otherwise. Note that normally server-side processing scripts will not perform regular expression searching for performance reasons on large data sets, but it is technically possible and at the discretion of your script

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Search.ExactMatch
member.summary: Specifies if the filter needs to be an exact match

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Order.Column
member.summary: Column to which ordering should be applied. This is an index reference to the columns array of information that is also submitted to the server

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.Order.Dir
member.summary: Ordering direction for this column. It will be asc or desc to indicate ascending ordering or descending ordering, respectively

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableResponse`1.TotalRecords
member.summary: Total records, before filtering (i.e. the total number of records in the database)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableResponse`1.RecordsFiltered
member.summary: Total records, after filtering (i.e. the total number of records after filtering has been applied - not just the number of records being returned for this page of data).

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableResponse`1.Data
member.summary: The data to be displayed in the table. This is an array of data source objects, one for each row, which will be used by DataTables.

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableResponse`1.TotalDisplayRecords
member.summary: Total records, before filtering (i.e. the total number of records in the database)

member.name: P:Crystal.Shared.Model.DataTableResponse`1.Error
member.summary: f an error occurs during the running of the server-side processing script, you can inform the user of this error by passing back the error message to be displayed using this parameter.
